segments.en: Linked Discourses 22
3. The Burden
27. Gratification (2nd)
At Sāvatthī.
“Mendicants, I went in search of form’s gratification,
and I found it.

segments.pli: Yāvatā rūpassa assādo paññāya me so sudiṭṭho.
segments.en: I’ve seen clearly with wisdom the full extent of form’s gratification.
I went in search of form’s drawback,
and I found it.

segments.pli: Yāvatā rūpassa ādīnavo paññāya me so sudiṭṭho.
segments.en: I’ve seen clearly with wisdom the full extent of form’s drawback.
I went in search of form’s escape,
and I found it.

segments.pli: Yāvatā rūpassa nissaraṇaṃ paññāya me taṃ sudiṭṭhaṃ.
segments.en: I’ve seen clearly with wisdom the full extent of form’s escape.
I went in search of the gratification of feeling …
perception …
choices …
and consciousness,
and I found it.

segments.pli: Yāvatā viññāṇassa assādo paññāya me so sudiṭṭho.
segments.en: I’ve seen clearly with wisdom the full extent of consciousness’s gratification.
I went in search of consciousness’s drawback,
and I found it.

segments.pli: Yāvatā viññāṇassa ādīnavo paññāya me so sudiṭṭho.
segments.en: I’ve seen clearly with wisdom the full extent of consciousness’s drawback.
I went in search of consciousness’s escape,
and I found it.

segments.pli: Yāvatā viññāṇassa nissaraṇaṃ paññāya me taṃ sudiṭṭhaṃ.
segments.en: I’ve seen clearly with wisdom the full extent of consciousness’s escape.

segments.pli: Yāvakīvañcāhaṃ, bhikkhave, imesaṃ pañcannaṃ upādānakkhandhānaṃ assādañca assādato ādīnavañca ādīnavato nissaraṇañca nissaraṇato yathābhūtaṃ nābbhaññāsiṃ … pe …
segments.en: As long as I didn’t truly understand these five grasping aggregates’ gratification, drawback, and escape for what they are, I didn’t announce my supreme perfect awakening …
But when I did truly understand these five grasping aggregates’ gratification, drawback, and escape for what they are, I announced my supreme perfect awakening …
Knowledge and vision arose in me:

segments.pli: ‘akuppā me vimutti; ayamantimā jāti; natthi dāni punabbhavo’”ti.
segments.en: ‘My freedom is unshakable; this is my last rebirth; now there are no more future lives.’”

suttaplex.blurb: When the Buddha fully knew the gratification, drawback, and escape regarding the five aggregates he became awakened.
